alert.note: Alert for Jasper; Newton (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 18 at 1:50AM CDT until June 18 at 2:45AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Cherokee County in southeastern Kansas... Southern Crawford County in southeastern Kansas... Western Newton County in southwestern Missouri... Western Jasper County in southwestern Missouri... * Until 245 AM CDT. * At 150 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Oswego to near Narcissa to near Grove, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Seneca, Mccune, West Mineral and Treece around 210 AM CDT. Baxter Springs and Scammon around 215 AM CDT. Columbus, Galena, Cherokee and Weir around 220 AM CDT. Pittsburg and Shoal Creek Drive around 230 AM CDT. Joplin, Carl Junction, Duquesne, Leawood, Silver Creek and Saginaw around 235 AM CDT. Webb City, Oronogo and Duenweg around 240 AM CDT. Carterville around 245 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Loma Linda, Airport Drive, Lowell, Sherman, Chicopee, Asbury, Redings Mill, Grand Falls Plaza, Shoal Creek Estates and Waco. This includes the following highways... Interstate 44 between mile markers 0 and 13. Interstate 49 between mile markers 16 and 35. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
